sources: anwar uses rally to gain sympathy new straits times malaysia , may 2, 2014 friday, local; pg. 10, 331 words, shahrum sayuthi; syed umar ariff; kalavaani karupiah; hashini kavishtri kannan; atiqa hazellah; balqis lim ;
notes: ? kuala lumpur: opposition leader datuk seri anwar ibrahim yesterday turned the opposition pact s rally to protest against the goods and services tax gst into a platform to express his unhappiness with the outcome of his sodomy case. speaking to a crowd of supporters, who had gathered in front of the sultan abdul samad building here, he condemned the march 7 decision by the court of appeal, which had sentenced him to five years jail for sodomising his former aide, mohd saiful bukhari azlan, six years ago. he accused the government of manipulating the judiciary and warned of dire consequences in the event he fails in his appeal at the federal court. anwar urged his supporters to hold more protests until the government was toppled instead of waiting for the next general election.? ?

sources: kl cabbies plan bigger protest on monday hl new straits times malaysia , june 7, 2014 saturday, pg. 1, 597 words, zarina zakariah; qistina hamizan;
notes: ? taxi drivers are expected to display a show of force to protest against a joint operation, called op bbklcc, at the city s golden triangle. it was reported that 250 city cabbies staged a protest on wednesday, in front of a shopping mall in jalan bukit bintang, to protest against the allegedly high handed manner the enforcement was carried out. the one hour protest had caused traffic to come to a standstill in jalan bukit bintang and the surrounding roads. after wednesday s protest, we had a discussion with spad and rtd, and told them our side of the story. so, we can t understand why the authorities are still going after us.

sources: pkns: datum jelatek protesters got it wrong. new straits times malaysia , january 27, 2015 tuesday, pg. 10;
notes: the selangor state development corporation pkns will take legal action against those making unfounded allegations to protest its datum jelatek housing project in datuk keramat. its general manager, azlan md alifiah, said it was disappointing that the sunday protest turned aggressive, and that public property was damaged. he said claims by datum jelatek action committee chairman salleh samad that the project would not benefit the malay community was not true as, of jan 14, 1,097 prospective bumiputera buyers had registered interest in buying the 674 units being built there. more than 1,000 protesters, calling themselves anak keramat , took part in the protest. they demanded that the project be halted and replaced with an affordable development, and for the preservation of the area for the malay community...met at the state secretariat building here, menteri besar azmin ali said an inquiry would be made into the protest and allegations that the project would turn the malay dominated area into a chinese district . we take into account all views expressed by the people. the datum jelatek project is not new, but we will make sure we get to the bottom of this. ...

protesteridentity: pkr members & supporters, pas members, dap members, pkr youth
sources: 1 rally fails to produce 1998 effect. new straits times malaysia , march 8, 2015 sunday, pg. 39, shahrum sayuthi; syed umar ariff; hana naz harun; zafira anwar; kalbana perimbanayagam; 2 pkr youth chief held. new straits times malaysia , march 9, 2015 monday, pg. 10, kalbana perimbanayagam; dawn chan;
notes: 1 it was supposed to trigger mass protests similar to the reformasi movement in the late 1990s, but it appeared to have not achieved its goal. the rally yesterday to demand the release of datuk seri anwar ibrahim from jail here attracted about 2,000 people, according to police estimates...leaders of protesters at the rally, however, insisted that there were more than 10,000 present...they only moved to the roadside after traffic policemen started clearing the way for vehicles. the bulk of the protesters appeared to be members and supporters of pkr, which anwar is the de facto leader. they were joined by a much smaller number of pas and dap members. among opposition leaders in the crowd were pkr president datuk seri dr wan azizah wan ismail, pkr secretary general rafizi ramli, pkr vice president nurul izzah anwar, pas central committee member khalid samad and dap organising secretary anthony loke. policemen monitoring the protest made their presence felt but did not interfere with the gathering in front of the shopping complex. pkr youth, which organised the rally, had not obtained permission from the police to proceed with it. security personnel of the shopping complex were also on standby...some of the speakers even urged the crowd to stay in the vicinity of klcc for the night as a mark of protest but, in the end, they dispersed just after 6pm... ; 2 pkr youth chief nik nazmi nik ahmad was arrested by police yesterday for his involvement in saturday s kitalawan rally in front of sogo shopping complex. dang wangi police chief assistant commissioner zainol samah said the seri setia assemblyman was detained at the district police headquarters at noon after having his statement recorded...

protesteridentity: taxi drivers, land public transport commission spad
sources: cabbies insist on higher fares due to rising costs. new straits times malaysia , march 23, 2015 monday, pg. 4, seri nor nadiah koris;
notes: taxi drivers will not comply with the cabinet s decision to postpone the implementation of the new fare rates. instead, they are prepared for a collision course with the authorities and charge the new rates announced by the land public transport commission spad . metered taxi drivers task force chairman amran jan said its members would not adhere to the decision by the cabinet. we are standing firm by our decision to continue with the new rates, as spad has not issued any instruction to revert to the old fares, he told a press conference here yesterday. present were hundreds of taxi drivers who gathered to protest against the decision by the cabinet...

sources: 50 people, including 2 mps, arrested. new straits times malaysia , march 24, 2015 tuesday, pg. 12;
notes: police arrested some 50 protesters after a scuffle during an anti goods and services tax gst rally at the kuala lumpur customs department in kelana jaya here yesterday. the 5pm incident happened when a mob of about 70 people stormed into the complex at 11am and refused to disperse until their demands were met. the crowd demanded that the department s director, datuk mohd isa endot, answer 106 questions on the implementation of gst, which will take effect on april 1. sungai siput member of parliament dr michael jeyakumar, who led the anti gst coalition group, together with kuala krai mp dr hatta ramli and suspended pkr member chegubard badrul hisham shahrin , claimed that the questions were collected from malaysians who were concerned about the implementation of gst and how it would affect their livelihood. we have gathered here today to get answers for these questions on gst, including technical issues, which will be implemented next week. however, the director, who came about 1pm, only answered the first question, which was whether we were ready for gst. he said that we are...there was heavy police presence....

protesteridentity: pakatan, anti gst group, pas, pas central committe
sources: opposition rally fails. new straits times malaysia , march 29, 2015 sunday, pg. 11, hidir reduan; c. premananthini; farhana syed nokman; hana naz harun; zafira anwar; hariz mohd;
notes: the much vaunted kita lawan rally yesterday failed to bring in the numbers, with many of pakatan s top leadership absent. the opposition led rally, which had an anti climactic ending, saw protesters, also made up of the anti gst group and those calling for the sacking of inspector general of police tan sri khalid abu bakar, dispersing as soon as it started to rain. among those present were pas central committe members khalid samad and dr dzulkefly ahmad, pkr strategic director sim tze tzin, jingga 13 head coordinator fariz musa and pkr kapar mp g. manivanan. no dap leaders were seen at the rally. the rally began with protesters gathering at dataran merdeka and pas headquarters in jalan raja laut here, before they started marching towards the sogo shopping complex which was supposed to be the convergent point. a few opposition leaders and supporters delivered fiery speeches under the watchful eyes of the police...they could not get near the convention centre which had been cordoned off...

sources: 60 stage protest in front of mab office. new straits times malaysia , may 1, 2015 friday, pg. 8;
notes: a group of blind people staged a protest in front of the office of the malaysian association for the blind mab in brickfields here yesterday. according to a news portal, about 60 protesters called for the resignation of mab s four top management members, whom they alleged were corrupt and had misappropriated the association s funds. the four were mab president tan sri tengku azlan sultan abu bakar, deputy president datuk dr veera ramani, vice president datuk s. kulasegaran and chief executive officer datuk ganesan supayah. one of the protesters, mohammed nazari othman, who is also the president for the society of the blind in malaysia, told the new straits times that they had staged the protest out of frustration as a result of mab s alleged mismanagement...the news portal reported that the two hour protest saw the crowd turning rowdy when they were barred from entering the office compound, with some resorting to climbing its front gate while others tried to storm it. the gates were opened after about half and hour as the demonstration continued under the watchful eyes of the police.

sources: ambiga among 30 held at anti gst rally. new straits times malaysia , may 2, 2015 saturday, pg. 5, arnaz m. khairul; hariz mohd; hani shamira shahrudin; kristy inus; avila geraldine;
notes: former bar council president datuk ambiga sreenevasan was one of the 30 people arrested following yesterday s anti goods and services tax gst protest in the city centre...rally organisers had expected a million protesters, but only about 4,500 participants showed up...

sources: cops arrest 29 at illegal rally. new straits times malaysia , august 2, 2015 sunday, pg. 18, khairah n. karim;
notes: acommotion that broke out at a rally yesterday saw the arrest of 29 protesters, including two opposition assemblymen...the rally, which was held in front of the sogo shopping complex, here, began with protesters demanding that prime minister datuk seri najib razak step down from his premiership over allegations concerning 1malaysia development bhd funds. about 200 protesters started gathering at the main entrance of the shopping complex from 2pm. the police then issued stern warning to rally organisers and participants not to go on with the demonstration and for the crowd to clear the area. the situation turned chaotic after the protesters refused to obey police orders and at least three firecracker explosions were heard. the crowd had by then swelled to 500 people, but most of whom were onlookers...among the first to be picked up were pkr youth leader chang lih kang teja and perak assemblyman tan kar hing simpang pulai for defying the warning to disperse.

sources: 1 huge protest held in malaysia against premier. the new york times, august 30, 2015 sunday, section a; column 0; foreign desk; pg. 4, by thomas fuller; khang tsung hui contributed reporting from kuala lumpur, malaysia; 2 no untoward incidents on first day. new straits times malaysia , august 30, 2015 sunday, pg. 13; 3 bersih fails to attract malays . new straits times malaysia , august 31, 2015 monday, pg. 14; 4 rumours spread based on misinformation. new straits times malaysia , august 31, 2015 monday, pg. 8, rosli zakaria; m. hamzah jamaludin; adib povera; arnaz m. khairul; syed umar ariff; minderjeet kaur; hariz mohd, koi kye lee; nuradzimmah daim; arman ahmad; aina nasa; adrian lai; tasnim lokman; hani shamira shahrudin; khairah n. karim; avila geraldine, kristy inus, esther thomas landau, sim bak heng, t.n. alagesh, faisal asyraf, amir hisyam rasid, tharanya arumugam; teoh pei ying; fazleena aziz; dawn chan; ili shazwani; nor ain mohamed radhi; priya pubalan; 5 bersih doesn t care about rural folk . new straits times malaysia , august 31, 2015 monday, pg. 8, rosli zakaria; m. hamzah jamaludin; adib povera; arnaz m. khairul; syed umar ariff; minderjeet kaur; hariz mohd, koi kye lee; nuradzimmah daim; arman ahmad; aina nasa; adrian lai; tasnim lokman; hani shamira shahrudin; khairah n. karim; avila geraldine, kristy inus, esther thomas landau, sim bak heng, t.n. alagesh, faisal asyraf, amir hisyam rasid, tharanya arumugam; teoh pei ying; fazleena aziz; dawn chan; ili shazwani; nor ain mohamed radhi; priya pubalan; 6 we can overcome petty prejudice. new straits times malaysia , september 1, 2015 tuesday, letters; pg. 19, c. sathasivam sitheravellu;
notes: 1 tens of thousands of demonstrators in malaysia defied police orders on saturday, massing in the capital in a display of anger at the government of prime minister najib razak, who has been accused of corruption involving hundreds of millions of dollars. the demonstration in central kuala lumpur, which had been planned for weeks, was declared illegal by the malaysian police, and on friday the government went as far as to pass a decree banning the yellow clothing worn by the protesters. but the demonstrators, who represent a broad coalition of civic organizations in malaysia, including prominent lawyers, asserted their right to protest on saturday. among other issues, they are angered at the transfer of 2.6 billion ringgit, about 630 million, into the personal bank accounts of mr. najib...the group organizing the protest goes by the name bersih, which means clean in malay...protesters gathered in kuala lumpur on saturday despite a police ban on the demonstration... ; 2 and despite the protest being illegal, police did not intervene, instead, they controlled the traffic wherever the people marched. however, the authorities did not allow protesters to enter dataran merdeka, the landmark and venue of tomorrow s national day parade...at the height of the protest, police estimated the turnout to be around 25,000. the organisers, however, claimed 200,000 had come out in support of bersih, though this seemed a bit farfetched...the rally last night went on as some protesters stayed back. it is expected to continue today until midnight...in kuching, some 3,000 people turned up for the rally, but a group of people from four villages later claimed that they were duped into attending the protest... ; 3 it is no secret that dap has turned to dominate the bersih 4 rally to further its political agenda rather than advocating real issues affecting the people... ; 4 over the 34 hours the bersih 4 rally took place here... ; 5 throughout the day yesterday, the crowd slowly grew, with police estimating close to 30,000 people in attendance at its height. the numbers fluctuated throughout the day, however, as people came and went and the weather, including rain, caused many to take shelter or go home. at one point, the organisers claimed 300,000 had attended, more than its 200,000 claim the previous day. like the previous day, however, the number seemed inflated. the crowd remained well behaved, as with the previous day, and police restricted themselves to security and traffic management...in kota kinabalu, only about 300 people took part in the rally...in kuching, the second day of the protest was cancelled after a fallout between state bersih 4 organisers and sarawak dap politicians... ; 6 rallies were held in 75 cities and 22 countries, painting a negative picture of our country s leadership...

sources: 1 investigate incident . new straits times malaysia , september 17, 2015 thursday, pg. 6, arnaz m. khairul; nuradzimmah daim; minderjeet kaur; zahratulhayat mat arif; awaina arbee; iskandar tajuddin; 2 cops: 50,000 showed up. new straits times malaysia , september 17, 2015 thursday, pg. 6, arnaz m. khairul; nuradzimmah daim; minderjeet kaur; zahratulhayat mat arif; awaina arbee; iskandar tajuddin; 3 troublemakers paid to make rally look bad . new straits times malaysia , september 17, 2015 thursday, pg. 7;
notes: 1 the rally had gone on without incident except when protesters in the bukit bintang area had to be turned back by police, and in petaling street, when water cannons had to be deployed against overly aggressive protesters clamouring to be let into the area... ; 2 the red shirt rally yesterday went mostly peacefully at its focal point in padang merbok, although it was marred by two incidents that main organisers, national silat federation pesaka , quickly moved to disassociate itself from. police said an estimated 50,000 people took part in the rally, called as a show of malay unity and to protest against gatherings, such as last month s bersih 4, which were allegedly aimed at bringing down a legitimately elected government. some of the rally organisers, however, put the figure at closer to 100,000...protesters broke through a police cordon at jalan raja chulan about 1.30pm, determined to march towards bukit bintang, but were met with a federal reserve unit fru blockade at the jalan bukit bintang jalan sultan ismail junction. that forced the group to march on along jalan sultan ismail towards the focal point in padang merbok, but it seemed that some had other ideas as a group began to converge at the entrance of chinatown in petaling street, which was also guarded by a strong police presence, later reinforced by several fru units, as the crowd began to turn unruly... ; 3 recited 14 resolutions for the red shirts rally goers to follow...he said the resolutions also included calls to reject racism; foreign intervention in national affairs; action against illegal rallies; accepting islam as the official religion of the country; supporting the government during economic difficulties; defending malay and bumiputera rights; defending the elected government; and restoring the internal security act...

sources: red shirt protesters gather at different venue. new straits times malaysia , october 19, 2015 monday, pg. 20;
notes: the save selangor from the pakatan government rally kicked off yesterday, but not at its planned venue. the rally, held at the ampang umno division building instead of the spectrum shopping mall in ampang jaya here, saw about 200 protesters voicing out their dissatisfaction with the state government. the speakers highlighted the state government s dismal record in helping people in selangor own affordable houses, as well as issues related to solid waste management, potholes, existence of numerous illegal gambling and vice dens, dengue epidemic and the recent toll hike...protesters, mostly wearing red shirts with the words selamatkan negeri selangor dari pakatan cacar marbar save selangor from the chaotic opposition , started chanting hidup rakyat long live the people at 3pm in front of the parking area of the building...

sources: cabbies go ahead with illegal rally. new straits times malaysia , november 19, 2015 thursday, pg. 20, faisal asyraf; iskandar tajuddin;
notes: more than 200 cabbies converged at padang merbok here to protest against the land public transport commission spad yesterday. the rally, organised by the taxi drivers action committee jbptlk , was to demand the resignation of spad chairman tan sri syed hamid albar, a revamp of spad and the banning of ride sharing services grabcar and uber...

sources: 200 protest against nurul izzah. new straits times malaysia , november 26, 2015 thursday, pg. 12;
notes: some 200 people staged a two hour peaceful protest at the main entrance of the state legislative assembly building here over the meeting between pkr vice president nurul izzah anwar and self styled sulu princess jacel kiram yesterday. the group comprising members of the public and non governmental organisation representatives, led by pakatan pro barisan nasional president zulkarnain mahdar who spoke at the gathering, handed a letter of protest to a representative of assembly speaker datuk syed abas syed ali. they called for the state assembly, currently in session, to approve a motion banning the lembah pantai member of parliament and pkr vice president tian chua, who was reported to have arranged the meeting between nurul izzah and jacel, from entering sabah...

location: Kota Darul Naim state secretariat building complex, Kota Baru
sources: group wants ban on sale of vape to be called off, new straits times malaysia , january 21, 2016 thursday, pg. 12, 267 words;
notes: more than 100 people gathered peacefully at the state secretariat building complex, kota darul naim here, yesterday, to protest the ban on the sale of vape and other items, effective from this month. the protesters gathered in a park in front of the building at 2pm. policemen were on hand to handle the crowd but there were no untoward incidents. the crowd dispersed at 3.15pm after mohd khaleb khan nasir khan, the spokesman for solidarity v kelantan, a group comprising vape sellers and users, handed a memorandum and a petition, signed by 1,000 users and traders, to the kelantan menteri besar s press secretary, asri awang.

protesteridentity: non governmental organisations kongres rakyat and bantah tppa
sources: pas members boo pkr veep at anti tpp protest, new straits times malaysia , january 24, 2016 sunday, pg. 16, 415 words;
notes: a rally to protest against the trans pacific partnership tpp agreement was held at padang merbok yesterday. co organised by non governmental organisations ngos , kongres rakyat and bantah tppa, and supported by other ngos, the protesters gathered at five venues, before converging at the field at 2pm. however, about 300 people were reported to have gathered at dataran merdeka even though city hall had allowed the event to take place only at padang merbok.

protesteridentity: a group led by former penang island city council mbpp councillor iszuree ibrahim
sources: 50 protest against penang govt reclamation project, new straits times malaysia , february 7, 2016 sunday, pg. 29, 393 words;
notes: former penang island city council mbpp councillor iszuree ibrahim led a group of 50 people yesterday to protest against the state government s plan to carry out a reclamation project along the permatang damar laut coast. iszuree, who is also penang pas secretary, said the project, slated under the rm27 billion penang transport master plan ptmp , should be scrapped to preserve marine life and the fishing communities source of income. the proposed land reclamation would see the construction of three man made islands some 300m from the shores of teluk kumbar, gertak sanggul and bayan lepas under ptmp.

protesteridentity: barisan nasional youth leaders and representatives from non governmental organisations
sources: 500 want cm to quit over land sale fiasco, new straits times malaysia , march 26, 2016 saturday, pg. 6, 275 words, audrey dermawan; phuah ken lin;
notes: some 500 people gathered outside the taman manggis land fronting jalan burma here yesterday to demand chief minister lim guan eng step down over the low cost housing fiasco in the state. the taman manggis land, where flats for poor people were supposed to be built, was sold to a company whose shareholder was purportedly linked to the previous owner of lim s bungalow in jalan pinhorn, which he bought for rm2.8 million last year. emotions ran high during the 30 minute protest as state barisan nasional youth leaders and representatives from non governmental organisations spoke out against lim, who is also dap secretary general. those present held placards denouncing lim for failing to address housing woes in the state. the group dispersed at 3pm.

location: Bukit Bintang, KLCC and KL Sentral in Kuala Lumpur
sources: taxi demo against uber, grabcar causes snarl up, new straits times malaysia , march 30, 2016 wednesday, pg. 6, 515 words, hariz mohd; aliza shah;
notes: a protest by hundreds of taxi drivers in bukit bintang, klcc and kl sentral here yesterday ended with five of them being arrested and two taxis seized by police. the rally was to protest against uber and grabcar ride sharing services. it started in jalan ampang at 10am before protesters headed for jalan bukit bintang and parked their taxis in front of a supermarket. more than 100 taxis parked on the road, causing a massive traffic jam. police had to divert traffic leading to jalan bukit bintang. the taxis seized were parked in the middle of the road, forcing authorities to tow them away to end the standstill. jalan bukit bintang was reopened to traffic at 12.30pm. it is learnt that those arrested included persatuan transformasi pemandu teksi malaysia pers1m president kamaruddin mohd hussain. i feel that it was my obligation to join in the protest to ensure the survival of taxi drivers. i don t care who organised the event. they want a total ban on uber and grabcar services and i support that.

sources: rancid river costing fishermen their livelihood, new straits times malaysia , april 3, 2016 sunday, pg. 18, 426 words;
notes: almost 200 fishermen from three villages in sungai masai have seen their catch dwindle for the past seven years due to pollution. the local council said the black and foul smelling water in some parts of the river was likely due to food waste from a nearby wet market and grime from lorry washing centres. southern johor fishermen association chairman azli mohd aziz said its members had experienced a 30 per cent decrease in their catch. the problem began in 2009 when the river water turned blackish. the situation forced many fishermen to venture further, nearer to singapore or pengerang, kota tinggi, as there is hardly any catch here, said azli after a peaceful demonstration by fishermen at the kampung pasir gudang baru jetty on thursday. he said residents were told that the pollution was allegedly caused by sewage from a septic tank in taman bukit dahlia, and that they were frustrated that their complaints had fallen on deaf ears. pasir gudang municipal council president md za nal misran said the local council would use microorganism technology to clean the river. malaysian nature society johor chairman vincent chow said the authorities should carry out strict enforcement to prevent the illegal dumping of waste into the river.

protesteridentity: anti goods and services tax gst protesters
sources: pas pours cold water on anti gst rally, new straits times malaysia , april 4, 2016 monday, pg. 4, 214 words;
notes: the anti gst rally on saturday has been proven unsuccessful judging from the low turnout of only 1,800 participants, said pas deputy president datuk tuan ibrahim tuan man. he said the campaign could only be described as otherwise in terms of traction, if people were to consider that it was pas which spearheaded protests against the implementation of the goods and services tax gst . we were not invited to participate in the rally. however, we have been campaigning against gst since the very beginning, including holding demonstrations. we have already sent a message to the government. pas members, too, are aware of the matter and the party s stand. they opted to stay out of the rally without the party having to issue any instruction, said tuan ibrahim. tuan ibrahim said pas was preoccupied with its branch meetings, preparations for the sarawak polls and organising protest against the implementation of dual language programme dlp in schools on saturday.

protesteridentity: former estate workers in hulu selangor and kuala selangor
sources: ex estate workers stage protest, new straits times malaysia , april 14, 2016 thursday, pg. 25, 282 words;
notes: left with just two days, 57 former estate workers in hulu selangor and kuala selangor are demanding the selangor government s intervention to ensure they are not forced out of their homes. the former estate workers of ladang mary, ladang sungai tinggi, ladang bukit tagar, ladang nigel gardner and ladang minyak received eviction notices last month, ordering them to move out of their quarters by tomorrow. the news was met with dissatisfaction as the promise of low cost homes has not been fulfilled. yesterday, the former workers held a peaceful protest at the entrance of the state secretariat building here. they came with a memorandum addressed to menteri besar datuk seri azmin ali and plantation workers, poverty and caring government committee chairman ganabatirau veraman. parti sosialis malaysia supreme council member s. arulchelvan, whom the former estate workers had turned to for assistance, handed over the memorandum to ganabatirau s policy adviser, k. vasantha kumar. arulchelvan said the eviction should be postponed or cancelled until a housing solution was found.

location: From Jalan Setiabakti to the site of a proposed high rise condominium in Jalan Setiakasih, Kuala Lumpur
sources: bukit damansara residents march against condo project, new straits times malaysia , april 17, 2016 sunday, pg. 16, 286 words, awaina arbee;
notes: some 250 residents of bukit damansara marched in protest against a 23 storey luxury condominium project yesterday. organised by the bukit damansara house owners association, the one kilometre walk took participants from jalan setiabakti to the site of the proposed high rise condominium in jalan setiakasih. association chairman tan sri abdul aziz abdul rahman said residents were protesting against the haphazard development that was incompatible with their neighbourhood, which was a low rise, low density area. this is supported by the kuala lumpur 2020 city plan draft, which clearly limits the neighbourhood s density to 24 people per 0.4ha, said aziz. the residents are calling on city hall to gazette the plan and reject the proposal to build luxury condominiums in bukit damansara. do not spoil this peaceful low rise, low density area.

location: Taman Tun Dr Ismail  TTDI , Kuala Lumpur
protesteridentity: residents of taman tun dr ismail ttdi
sources: 500 say no to apartment plan, new straits times malaysia , june 27, 2016 monday, pg. 22, 357 words;
notes: residents of taman tun dr ismail ttdi gathered at taman rimba kiara yesterday to stage a peaceful protest against a new development project in the park. ttdi residents association chairman abdul hafiz abu bakar announced two objectives during the protest to call for kuala lumpur city hall dbkl to stop receiving plans for development in the park and to gazette the public park as a public open space. the move to gazette the park as a public open space has been long overdue. there will be threats of development in this park until it is gazetted, he said, adding that they had also urged the authorities to proceed with the redevelopment of housing for 100 longhouse families, promised 30 years ago. we are appealing to the authorities to leave taman rimba kiara as a public park for the residents of ttdi. this is where we hold outdoor activities and wedding receptions. we will tabulate the number of signatures on the petition and send it to the authorities tomorrow. nearly 500 supporters, ranging from the elderly to children, turned up to protest against the proposed redevelopment of the site to house eight blocks of 54 storey serviced apartments, and a block of apartments with 350 affordable units. apart from damage to the park, the redevelopment will raise the density of 60 persons per acre to as high as 979 persons per acre.

location: District and land office, Kuala Selangor
sources: villagers protest unfair land distribution, new straits times malaysia , september 16, 2016 friday, pg. 27, 648 words;
notes: some 100 residents of kampung sungai yu held a peaceful demonstration in front of the district and land office here yesterday, demanding that the state government review its list of recipients for residential lots meant for underprivileged members of the indian community. the demonstrators alleged that the pkr led state government had conducted the distribution of lots in an unfair and non transparent manner by awarding them to undeserving parties. kampung sungai yu residents representative m. palanivel said they were shocked to learn that most of the recipients were not local people, including some who are not from selangor, but from other states such as negri sembilan, penang and johor. palanivel and several other representatives also handed over a three page memorandum to principal assistant district officer land division mohd faizal abdul raji.

sources: wheelchair bound folk want friendly access to mall, new straits times malaysia , september 27, 2016 tuesday, pg. 24, 381 words;
notes: going to mid valley megamall here is a hassle for wheelchair bound shoppers, who are forced to cross a busy road outside the shopping mall with the help of auxiliary policemen. damai disabled person association malaysia president v. murugeswaran, 45, said those on wheelchair arriving from mid valley ktm komuter station would have to seek assistance from the mall authorities to enter the premises safely. two auxiliary policemen were stationed at the sidewalk near the komuter station and the mall s entrance to assist the disabled. the komuter station is just beside the mall but there is no direct entrance for wheelchair bound visitors. the obstacles, such as the busy road and big dividers, make it difficult to enter the mall. the simplest and most immediate solution would be to build a lift at the pedestrian bridge that links the station and the mall s first floor entrance at the north court. he was involved in a peaceful demonstration by members of two non governmental organisations outside the mall s north court entrance here yesterday. some 50 members and volunteers of damai and dual blessing bhd gathered at the venue to demand long term solutions for this problem as well as the poor accessibility for disabled people in public places in the city. we want to live independently but the lack of proper access to these establishments makes it hard for us. we hope the authorities will provide permanent solutions to this problem, he said.

location: Gurney Drive, George Town; from Menara Umno to Komtar, George Town
protesteridentity: people from non governmental organisations and umno youth
sources: 3,000 demand lim s resignation, new straits times malaysia , october 2, 2016 sunday, pg. 8, 427 words, audrey dermawan; 3,000 want penang cm to quit, new straits times malaysia , october 27, 2016 thursday, pg. 13, 319 words, phuah ken lin;
notes: some 3,000 people from non governmental organisations and umno youth flooded gurney drive on october 1st, demanding that chief minister lim guan eng relinquish his post following graft charges against him. they continuously chanted undur lim guan eng step down lim guan eng , undur perasuah step down, corrupt , hancur dap destroy dap and hancur lim guan eng destroy lim guan eng . they also held banners that read guan eng undur guan eng step down and polis jangan lulus permit bersih 5.0 police, don t approve bersih 5.0 permit . the crowd voiced their dissatisfaction with lim, who, they said, had put penang in the spotlight by being its first chief minister to face graft charges. they also called for him to be booted out in the next general election. they urged police not to grant a permit to bersih 5.0 organisers to hold the gathering in the state. northeast district police chief assistant commissioner mior faridalatrash wahid said police would investigate under section 9 5 of the peaceful assembly act as the organisers had not given any notice on yesterday s gathering. he said police had identified those who took to the stand to speak and would call them in for questioning. however, they abided by our warning when we asked them to disperse, he said, adding that no untoward incident was reported. about 3,000 people marched from menara umno to komtar october 26th, calling for chief minister lim guan eng s resignation. clad in black t shirts bearing the word bangkit rise , the protesters chanted undur step down guan eng repeatedly as they raised banners. the march started about 1.50pm and the group arrived at komtar 10 minutes later. the group was led by umno youth vice chief khairul azwan harun and penang umno youth chief rafizal abdul rahim. we will hold similar demonstrations if lim refuses to meet our demand to stay away from the bersih 5.0 rally, khairul said. the crowd dispersed about 2.35pm.

location: From the Shah Alam City Council headquarters to the state secretariat, Kuala Lumpur
sources: umno education bureau backs flying bucket protest, new straits times malaysia , november 3, 2016 thursday, pg. 25, 394 words;
notes: the umno education bureau has defended the group involved in a flying buckets protest on tuesday, as people have a right to be angry over water problems in selangor. its chairman, tan sri dr ibrahim shah abu shah, said he hoped the protest would make selangor menteri besar datuk seri azmin ali aware of the people s anger and find a solution to the issue. i think we should support them the protesters . i m not angry with the people who expressed their anger towards the menteri besar. the water problem is serious. you can t survive without water, it is a basic need in life, he said here yesterday. ibrahim said azmin s claim that barisan nasional and umno had sabotaged his government by contaminating sungai semenyih should be investigated and that action should be taken against him if his claim was proven to be false. about 100 people, led by umno youth executive committee member datuk armand azha abu hanifah, started marching from the shah alam city council headquarters to the state secretariat. they demanded the state government resolve the water issues fast instead of blaming the problem on alleged sabotage. after about 45 minutes, azmin s political secretary shuhaimie shafiei met the protesters before allowing armand and several others into the compound. the protesters dispersed around noon.

protesteridentity: bersih, malaysia s clean government movement
sources: protest calls for malaysian leader to quit, the new york times, november 20, 2016 sunday, section a; column 0; foreign desk; pg. 10, 425 words, by richard c. paddock; 8 men nabbed over rallies, new straits times malaysia , november 20, 2016 sunday, pg. 4, 609 words, melissa darlyne chow; adrian lai; ahmad fairuz othman; rahmat khairulrijal; faisal asyraf; aliza shah; amin mokhtar; june moh; naim zulkifli; arfa yunus; hani shamira shahrudin; farhana syed nokman; farezza hanum rashid; audrey dermawan; phuah ken lin; kristy inus; avila geraldine; olivia miwil; adrian david; halim said; adib povera; goh pei pei; hidir reduan; nur aqidah azizi; cops arrest 21 over rallies, release 10, new straits times malaysia , november 21, 2016 monday, pg. 5, 426 words, naim zulkifli;
notes: tens of thousands of people took to the streets of kuala lumpur, the capital of malaysia, on saturday to call for the resignation of prime minister najib razak, who is accused of taking 1 billion from a government investment fund. the protesters, wearing the yellow t shirts of malaysia s clean government movement, known as bersih, converged on the city center to hear their leaders call for mr. najib s ouster. among the speakers was former prime minister mahathir mohamad, 91, who once chose mr. najib as prime minister but now criticizes his former prot g s government as corrupt. the authorities had tried to thwart the daylong, peaceful demonstration by arresting at least eight protest leaders on friday, including bersih s chairwoman, maria chin abdullah. she was being held under the country s strict security offenses act. this was the fifth year that bersih, whose name means clean in malay, had staged a protest calling for an end to corruption in government. bersih also organized smaller protests calling for mr. najib s resignation in cities around the world. police arrested 21 key people connected to the bersih and red shirts movements. some had brought children, an offence under the peaceful assembly act 2012 paa . city police chief datuk amar singh said the men who were arrested during the rallies included activist hishamuddin rais, pasir pinji assemblyman howard lee and red shirts prominent figure datuk armand azha abu hanifah. activist fahmi reza was nabbed after the bersih 5 rally ended. he said of the three others, the first to be arrested was a 49 year old, who was found to have been using a drone. amar said this was an offence under section 143 of the civil aviation act 1969, which stipulates that the use of an unmanned aircraft or drone in areas where people are gathered requires the approval of the authorities. another 33 year old man was detained under section 323 of the penal code for causing hurt. amar said the number of people who attended the bersih 5 rally was estimated to be 15,500, while about 2,500 red shirts supporters took part in the group s counter rally.

location: From Padang Merbok to Parliament House, Kuala Lumpur
protesteridentity: bersih and women s aid organisation
sources: 300 protest outside parliament, new straits times malaysia , november 24, 2016 thursday, pg. 10, 312 words;
notes: about 300 protesters gathered outside parliament yesterday to demand the release of bersih 2.0 chairman maria chin abdullah, who was detained under the security offences special measures act sosma 2012 on friday, a day before the coalition s rally in the city. the group, mostly made up of women, made its way from padang merbok to parliament house at 10.45am. the protest was led by former bersih chairman datuk s. ambiga, g25 spokesman datuk noor farida ariffin and former women s aid organisation head ivy josiah. among the politicians who took part in the rally were ampang member of parliament zuraida kamaruddin and selangor state assembly speaker hannah yeoh. the march was, however, blocked 100m before the parliament gate by some 30 policemen at 11.15am. only a handful of representatives were allowed in to submit the group s memorandum. ambiga said the memorandum was received by minister in the prime minister s department datuk seri dr shahidan kassim.

protesteridentity: residents of villages surrounding taman rimba ampang that are frustrated over a proposed housing project at the recreation park
sources: residents protest proposed housing project at ampang park, new straits times malaysia , april 3, 2017 monday, pg. 25, 248 words;
notes: residents of villages surrounding taman rimba ampang are frustrated over a proposed housing project at the recreation park. they claimed that an individual had illegally sold off 1.62ha of land, consisting of 48 lots, mostly to foreigners. from taman rimba ampang s car park, it was evident that some clearing work had been carried out. persatuan muafakat lembah jaya utara president noor ashraf mashal khan had lodged a police report on march 28. we are against a housing project here and want it to remain and be maintained as a public recreational park. in fact, we want this place to bloom into a tourist attraction, where we can attract local and foreign visitors, he said at a protest yesterday. ampang umno youth executive council member muhammad shahdiq abd rahman said although the portion of land in question belonged to the state, which any malaysian can purchase, the individual in question had not obtained approval from the authorities. note: the number of protesters was not included in the source, and is based on prior coding decisions

sources: protest over 3 storey development, new straits times malaysia , may 7, 2017 sunday, pg. 17, 395 words, kalbana perimbanayagam;
notes: kuala lumpur: a group of residents from bukit bandaraya here gathered yesterday in protest of a three storey development at the corner of jalan tualang and jalan maarof in bangsar. about 50 residents held a peaceful protest against the corner lot building at the entrance of jalan tualang, as they claimed that continued commercialisation in the neighbourhood would further inconvenience the 53 families living there. the bukit bandaraya residents association s president, jeswant singh, said the residents had opposed the project through numerous complaints to city hall but all fell on deaf ears.

protesteridentity: protesters against seberang prai municipal council s mpsp apparent inaction over the mushrooming of illegal factories despite countless complaints
sources: hidden hands behind illegal factories?, new straits times malaysia , august 12, 2017 saturday, pg. 4, 447 words;
notes: are there hidden hands facilitating operations of several illegal factories in seberang prai, including the carbon filter factory in sungai lembu, which was raided by the malaysian anti corruption commission macc yesterday? that was the question raised by permatang pauh umno division chief datuk mohd zaidi mohd said concerning seberang prai municipal council s mpsp apparent inaction over the mushrooming of illegal factories despite countless complaints. zaidi said the carbon factory was not the only illegal factory in seberang prai as he had been informed by locals that there were up to eight found operating on mainland penang. he said it would be a matter of utmost concern if local authorities were facilitating illegal operations. present was parti cinta malaysia deputy president datuk huan cheng guan. zaidi and huan later joined a protest against the illegal carbon filter factory. protesters held placards which read masyarakat berterima kasih kepada sprm the people thank macc , mana pbt bantahan kami tak dipeduli where is the local council? our complaints have fallen on deaf ears and sudah lama buat kerja haram they have been operating illegally for a long time . note: the number of protesters was not included in the source, and was determined based on prior coding decisions

protesteridentity: protesters supporting the families of those affected by the deadly memali incident in 1985
sources: see affected families, pas tells dr m, new straits times malaysia , august 15, 2017 tuesday, pg. 8, 357 words, adrian lai; 3 youths remanded for riot, new straits times malaysia , august 15, 2017 tuesday, pg. 8, 314 words; zahid condemns violence, new straits times malaysia , august 15, 2017 tuesday, pg. 10, 297 words, hana naz harun;
notes: pas has urged tun dr mahathir mohamad to visit the families of those affected by the deadly memali incident, which sparked the violence that shook the nothing to hide 2.0 forum in shah alam on sunday. pas secretary general datuk takiyuddin hassan said he hoped the gesture would bring closure to the incident, which took place in 1985 during dr mahathir s tenure as prime minister. on sunday, a riot occurred during the nothing to hide 2.0 forum, which saw several attendees injured when a group of people threw a lit flare, slippers and chairs. the commotion began shortly after a member of the audience asked dr mahathir about the memali incident. midway through the former prime minister s reply, someone in the audience stood up and threw a shoe at him. this was immediately followed by others, who started throwing water bottles, slippers and chairs towards the main stage where dr mahathir and event moderator azhar harun were sitting. three youths, aged between 17 and 19, were placed under a remand order by the magistrate s court here to facilitate a probe into sunday s riot at nothing to hide 2.0 forum at section 7. magistrate raja noor adilla raja mahyaldin granted four days remand against the trio, two of whom were college students, upon hearing an application by shah alam police yesterday morning. shah alam police chief assistant commissioner shafien mamat said they were investigating the incident under section 15 2 d of the peaceful assembly act 2012 and section 153 of the penal code causing provocation with intent to cause riot . deputy prime minister datuk seri dr ahmad zahid hamidi has condemned the violence that erupted at the nothing to hide 2.0 forum in shah alam. the police in their response took action according to the standard operating procedures, he said after opening the 37th world congress of international association for hydro environment engineering and research here yesterday. a commotion broke out shortly after a member of the audience asked dr mahathir about the 1985 memali incident in kedah. chaos ensued for about half an hour when a mob chased a man into the hall and beat him up. another group of men shielded him from the mob. a security officer claimed that the assailants were targeting dr mahathir when they threw objects, including two flares, in his direction. the police deployed a light strike force anti riot team at 6.30pm. note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the sources, and was based on prior coding decisions

protesteridentity: non governmental organisations that are opposed to festivals that celebrated alcohol and the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community in malaysia
sources: 25 groups rally against festivals celebrating alcohol, lgbt community, new straits times malaysia , september 23, 2017 saturday, pg. 27, 233 words;
notes: some 25 non governmental organisations came together yesterday to protest against festivals that celebrated alcohol and the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community in malaysia. the group s spokesman, nazilah idris, said they were strongly against such activities being held openly. we urge the government to not approve permits or requests to organise any festivals that insult the sanctity of islam. this is a threat to the islamic institution. we also call on the government to enact a law to permit alcohol consumption only in the house or closed areas. people should be prohibited from drinking alcohol outside or in public areas, and from organising festivals that promote drinking. about 100 people took part in the protest after friday prayers.

protesteridentity: protesters opposed to losing a public park to development
sources: 300 upset over show house nod, new straits times malaysia , november 27, 2017 monday, pg. 11, 323 words, esther landau;
notes: more than 300 people gathered to protest against kuala lumpur city hall s approval of the construction of a show house at taman rimba kiara in taman tun dr ismail here yesterday. ttdi resident association president abdul hafiz abu bakar said they first knew about the approval during court proceedings on nov 15. he said the residents were upset as they would lose the public park to development. we had a town hall meeting with federal territories minister datuk seri tengku adnan tengku mansor on nov 3 to discuss the matter. we were promised that the park would be left alone. however, during the hearing on nov 15, we found out that city hall had approved the construction of the show house. the approval was given to the developer on nov 6. this was done in bad faith, so, we are holding the protest to show we are serious in protecting the park. the suit was filed by the ttdi residents association against city hall in opposition of the construction of eight blocks of 42 and 52 storey, high end service apartments and a 29 storey affordable housing block, which would provide 350 units of affordable housing for former ttdi longhouse residents.

location: The Registry of Societies headquarters, Putrajaya
protesteridentity: parti pribumi bersatu malaysia ppbm members
sources: ros urged to take action against ppbm, new straits times malaysia , february 23, 2018 friday, pg. 8, 339 words, azura abas; siti a isyah sukaimi;
notes: the registry of societies ros must take action against parti pribumi bersatu malaysia ppbm if the party is found to have breached its constitution. ppbm founding member and former executive secretary kamarul azman habibur rahman said ros must not give special treatment to the party. why is it hesitant to act against ppbm? just because the party is led by tun dr mahathir mohamad, special treatment is accorded to it. this should not be so as this is a form of injustice, he said, after handing a memorandum to ros management division director mohd rejab ramli. kamarul azman led a peaceful protest by some 1,000 ppbm members in front of ros headquarters. clad in red t shirts, ppbm members staged the rally to urge ros to act against the party for alleged violations of its constitution. a statement that was handed out said no action had been taken even though more than 400 complaints against ppbm and its leaders had been submitted to ros. it said party chairman dr mahathir had acted like a dictator by labelling those who pointed out the mistakes allegedly committed by party leaders as garbage and useless . the party belongs to the people and not for anyone s interest, especially certain party leaders.

protesteridentity: a group of gagasan sejahtera supporters
sources: another call for rci into memali incident, new straits times malaysia , march 10, 2018 saturday, pg. 8, 358 words, aizat sharif;
notes: a group of gagasan sejahtera supporters held a peaceful demonstration calling for the setting up of a royal commission of inquiry rci into the memali incident three decades ago. the group, comprising pas and non governmental organisation suara islam members, also called for an investigation into the wealth of former prime minister tun dr mahathir mohamad s family. we want the government to form a rci into the memali incident so that the public will know the truth about what had happened and who was responsible for the deaths, the group s spokesman, mohd rozi rashid, said in front of masjid derga al irfan here. in the memali incident, 18 people, including four policemen, were killed. the tragedy left many injured after police tried to arrest religious teacher ibrahim mahmud, known as ibrahim libya. ibrahim was among those who died. note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the source, and was based on prior coding decisions

protesteridentity: taman tun dr ismail ttdi residents
sources: ttdi residents hold picnic protest , new straits times malaysia , march 25, 2018 sunday, pg. 26, 417 words;
notes: outraged taman tun dr ismail ttdi residents held a picnic protest at taman rimba kiara over the housing development at the park. more than 50 residents protested against the preliminary construction works, which began on march 14 despite a pending judicial review. ttdi residents association vice chairman clinton ang said construction works had resulted in more than a dozen trees being uprooted to make way for an alternative route into the park. the judicial review is ongoing and the matter has yet to be decided in court. the decision would be in april, so why the rush? this park belongs to the people and we are angry the developers are showing no regard to the ongoing judicial review, he said during the picnic protest yesterday. ttdi residents gathered at the park with placards saying parks are for people, not condos and less invasion, more conservation .the kuala lumpur high court had granted leave for ttdi community representatives to pursue the judicial review against kuala lumpur city hall dbkl over the development. however, the high court appellate and special powers judge justice kamaludin md said recently dismissed the stay order by ttdi residents against the project.

sources: protest tarnished country s image , new straits times malaysia , march 29, 2018 thursday, pg. 5, 367 words, anwar patho rohman; meor riduwan ahmad; adib povera; hidir reduan; rohaniza idris; nadia hamid; fairul asmaini hussin; iskandar ibrahiml; safeek affendy razali; nor lela zulkifli; nor ain mohamed radhi; farhana syed nokman; nor azizah mokhtar; hafidzul helmi; ahmad suhael adnan; faris fuad;
notes: the protest by electoral reform group bersih 2.0 yesterday tarnished the country s reputation and parliament s image, kuala selangor member of parliament datuk seri dr irmohizam ibrahim said. he said people should not resort to demonstrations as the only means to express unhappiness over an issue. some do it to attract foreign media attention and show that malaysia is in turmoil. a gathering to create such negative perception will only open doors for foreign media to sensationalise the news without considering the impact it has on the country s image, he said. it was reported that about 300 people had gathered in front of the parliament building to protest against the tabling of the redelineation report. protesters, clad in bersih 2.0 s yellow t shirt and carrying placards, arrived as early as 8am, despite heavy police presence in the vicinity of tugu negara and outside parliament house. bernama reported that police would call in the organisers for holding the protest without a permit. although there were some minor incidents, they were brought under control by the 400 police personnel, including the federal reserve unit.

protesteridentity: muslim groups protesting in favor of defending islam and decades old affirmative action policies that benefit malays
sources: muslims rally to defend privileges in multi ethnic malaysia, agence france presse english, december 8, 2018 saturday 11:38 am gmt, 506 words, kuala lumpur, dec 8 2018
notes: tens of thousands of banner waving muslims rallied in the malaysian capital saturday to defend their long cherished privileges, at a time of growing racial tensions in the multi ethnic country. about 55,000 people dressed in white flooded a historic square in downtown kuala lumpur, according to police, chanting god is great and brandishing banners that read long live the malays . large numbers of police were on the streets and major roads were closed for the event, which was the first major rally since prime minister mahathir mohamad won a shock election victory in may and toppled the scandal mired old regime. race and religion are sensitive in malaysia, which is home to sizeable ethnic chinese and indian communities, and the muslim malay majority appears to be feeling increasingly insecure under a new government that is more representative of minorities. the rally was originally intended as a protest against a plan by the government to ratify a un convention which aims to eliminate racial discrimination. authorities abandoned the plan after opposition from conservative politicians and malays, who feared the treaty could erode their privileged position in society. but muslim groups pushed ahead with saturday s demonstration, which alongside the convention became about the bigger issue of defending islam and decades old affirmative action policies that benefit malays. if islam is disturbed, is race is disturbed, if our rights are disturbed, then we will rise, opposition leader ahmad zahid hamidi, whose united malays national organisation umno party was ousted at this year s election, told the gathering.

sources: the latest: german car sharing firms issue may day warning, associated press international, may 1, 2019 wednesday 12:31 pm gmt, business news, 1223 words, berlin
notes: thousands of trade union members and activists are marking may day by marching through asia s capitals and demanding better working conditions and expanding labor rights. a south korean major umbrella trade union has issued a joint statement with a north korean workers organization calling for the koreas to push ahead with engagement commitments made during a series of inter korean summits last year. may day rallies are also being held in the philippines, malaysia, cambodia, myanmar and elsewhere in asia. note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the source, and is based on prior coding decisions. note: the exact protest locations were not provided in the source

protesteridentity: protesters against the appointment of muhyiddin yassin as the country s new prime minister
sources: malaysia s mahathir loses bid to return as prime minister, associated press international, february 29, 2020 saturday 3:42 pm gmt, international news, 749 words, by eileen ng, associated press, kuala lumpur, malaysia
notes: kuala lumpur, malaysia ap malaysia s king on saturday appointed seasoned politician muhyiddin yassin as the country s new leader, trumping mahathir mohamad s bid to return to power after a week of political turmoil that followed his resignation as prime minister. but hours later, mahathir challenged muhyiddin s appointment. he named 114 lawmakers that support his bid for a comeback as prime minister for a third time, surpassing the 112 votes needed for a simple majority. the appointment of muhyiddin, who heads mahathir s bersatu party, will ironically bring back to power the united malays national organization, which was ousted by mahathir s alliance in a historic vote in may 2018. it also has stoked fears of rising islamization with the inclusion of a fundamentalist islamic party. a few dozen malaysians rallied saturday night in the city to protest what they called the death of democracy.

notes: 1 the protest comes after the public transport council ptc announced on jan 16 that bus and train fares would increase by 3.2 per cent from april 6. the two hour event, which started at about 5.20pm, was organised by mr gilbert goh, founder of the movement for a better singapore. speakers included opposition member osman sulaiman, and lawyer m. ravi. they spoke mainly about the spate of train disruptions, as well as how smrt s current and former chief executives mr desmond kuek and ms saw phaik hwa, respectively had no experience in running public transport systems... ; 2 his effigy was toted out two weeks ago at hong lim park, where some 300 people gathered to protest against the public transport fare hike in april...

sources: protest speakers air their grievances. the straits times singapore , may 2, 2014 friday, singapore, charissa yong;
notes: several speakers led by the head of a support group for the unemployed spoke at hong lim park yesterday, lashing out at what they described as pro foreigner policies and the high influx of foreign workers. the labour day protest organised by mr gilbert goh lasted three hours, with many speakers stressing they were not being xenophobic, and that their main interest lay in protecting singaporean workers...mr goh said the event was attended by about 500 to 600 people in total...

sources: cpf protest draws crowd; nine speakers hit out at what they say are inflexible, shifting rules. the straits times singapore , june 8, 2014 sunday, news; home;
notes: amid the ongoing public debate about the central provident fund cpf system, a large crowd gathered at hong lim park yesterday to protest against several aspects of the compulsory savings plan. the nine speakers at the return our cpf protest criticised what they perceived to be the inflexible and shifting rules of the scheme, its low rate of returns and the lack of transparency in how cpf monies are managed by the government...she estimated that 6,000 turned up yesterday, though some news agencies reported a crowd size of 2,000...

sources: hundreds attend cpf protest the straits times singapore , july 13, 2014 sunday, news; home, 304 words, charissa yong;
notes: ? hundreds of people gathered at a rally to protest against central provident fund cpf and medishield life policies at hong lim park yesterday? mr tan criticised the recently approved medishield life universal health insurance scheme for not covering medicine for chronic diseases like diabetes, while ms chong proposed another way to finance the programme? he called on the government to be more transparent about how cpf monies were being invested, and questioned why interest rates were low. the cpf is not a cheap source of funding, he said during his hour long speech, adding: we should take our money back.

sources: when protests cross the line; public opinion has been charged over the hong lim park disturbance last saturday, when a protest against the central provident fund cpf disrupted a charity carnival. walter sim and rachel au yong examine what the incident means for civil society discourse in singapore. the straits times singapore , october 4, 2014 saturday, insight, 2604 words;
notes: ? several hundred people, largely retirees, turned up to hear ms han and blogger roy ngerng, 33, speak about central provident fund issues? .waving singapore flags, they stopped near the stage, in front of which sat rows of elderly guests, and shouted chants, including return our cpf and vote them out, pap .

sources: fourth protest held against population white paper. the straits times singapore , february 1, 2015 sunday, news; home, walter sim;
notes: a few hundred people turned up at the speakers corner in hong lim park yesterday to attend a protest against issues such as an influx of foreigners into singapore. the event was the fourth in a series of protests against the population white paper, which caused an outcry in 2013 by outlining planning parameters for a bigger population of 6.9 million by 2030...other issues that received an airing yesterday included public transport fare hikes and inequality in benefits for single mothers.

sources: opposition parties want more done for workers. the straits times singapore , may 2, 2015 saturday, top of the news, rachel au yong;
notes: as the government celebrated labour day yesterday with unions and employers, opposition politicians voiced concerns about sluggish wage rises and white collar workers being retrenched...both parties criticised the tripartite relationship between the government, unions and employers. in the face of strong corporate lobbying and government pressures, the interests of the workers will always remain subservient to these, said mr chiam. similar concerns were raised at the speakers corner in hong lim park, where some 400 people attended a rally organised by activist gilbert goh...

sources: left wing youth clash with police. the straits times singapore , may 3, 2015 sunday, think; home; may 1 , ho ai li , china correspondent in beijing;
notes: more than 5,000 youth from 30 left wing unions clashed with police in different parts of singapore as they tried to hold a mass may day demonstration. the police broke up 21 incidents, including seven major ones, and arrested 21 people. no one was hurt. the demonstrators were thwarted by police officers wielding batons and shields in areas such as prinsep street. in one incident, groups of 200 protesters holding anti us and anti government banners gathered at the junction of victoria street and sumbawa road. the police fired tear gas into the mob and charged with batons, causing the demonstrators to flee. in another major incident that day, about 300 youth tried to make their way in twos and threes in keeping with the law down new bridge road and into hill street, to go near the american consulate there. but the police were waiting. canisters of tear gas were shot into the crowd. overall, the protesters did not pose enough of a threat to warrant a state wide curfew. they were thwarted almost as soon as they assembled, reported the straits times...

protesteridentity: protesters opposed to a forthcoming rise in water prices
sources: about 100 gather for water price hike protest, the straits times singapore , march 12, 2017 sunday, home, 361 words, charissa yong;
notes: the upcoming rise in water prices saw about 100 people turn up at hong lim park yesterday to protest against it. speakers criticised the government s explanation that the cost of producing water has risen and that investments need to be made in water infrastructure. the hike was announced in last month s budget and will take effect in two phases, starting in july. the rally was organised by career counsellor gilbert goh, a former reform party candidate in the 2015 general election. former singapore democratic party candidate paul tambyah, an infectious diseases specialist, criticised the timing of the hike at a period of economic hardship .

protesteridentity: protesters opposed to allegations of abuse of power by prime minister lee hsien loong
sources: 400 attend protest on oxley road issue, the straits times singapore , july 16, 2017 sunday, home, 219 words, joanna seow;
notes: about 400 people gathered at hong lim park yesterday at a protest over allegations of abuse of power by prime minister lee hsien loong. the three hour event was organised by career counsellor gilbert goh, a reform party rp candidate in ang mo kio grc in the 2015 general election. the allegations were made by pm lee s younger siblings lee wei ling and lee hsien yang last month on social media over their father s house at 38, oxley road. pm lee and several ministers rebutted the allegations, including at a debate in parliament on the issue, where pm lee said no evidence to back those claims had surfaced. the younger siblings and pm lee have since agreed to try and iron out their differences in private. yesterday, mr goh and eight speakers used a stage with a backdrop reading singapore belongs to singaporeans and not to the fami lee . psychiatrist ang yong guan, a former singaporeans first candidate, said the parliament debate had failed to find closure on the issue. private educator sivakumaran chellappa asked if conserving the house would result in a highly political icon which can be used when a mandate was needed from citizens.

protesteridentity: protesters against the planned hike in the goods and services tax gst announced at the budget
sources: protest against gst hike draws 120 people, the straits times singapore , march 4, 2018 sunday, home, 310 words, joanna seow;
notes: despite the dark clouds overhead, about 120 people gathered at hong lim park yesterday for a protest against the planned hike in the goods and services tax gst announced at the budget. the protest was organised after finance minister heng swee keat said last month that the gst will be raised from 7 per cent to 9 per cent between 2021 and 2025, to pay for increased government spending in the next decade.

protesteridentity: protesters in a pink dot demonstration demanding the repeal of a statute that criminalizes sex between men
sources: a global gay pride weekend, in photos, the new york times, june 30, 2019 sunday 20:41 est, world, 491 words, lauren messman
notes: parades to celebrate gay pride were held around the world this weekend, commemorating the 50th anniversary of the stonewall uprising in new york. it was a day to recognize gains and demand new ones. gathered in a pink dot demonstration in singapore, protesters demanded the repeal of a statute that criminalizes sex between men in the country. the annual event, which promotes the acceptance of the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people, is the closest thing singapore has to a gay pride parade. note: the actual number of protesters was not included in the source, and is based on prior coding decisions.

sources: toronto star, december 10, 1990, p. a20, aquino dumps chief amid protests ;
notes: philippine president corazon aquino replaced her chief of staff today in the first phase of a cabinet revamp to tackle a deepening economic crisis. thousands demonstrated in manila against an increase in oil prices last week that averaged 45 per cent. there were protests in at least 12 other cities. transport secretary oscar orbos will replace catalino macaraig, who co ordinated energy policies. aquino vowed yesterday she would replace ineffective ministers.

sources: sydney morning herald, december 20, 1990, news and features; leaders; pg. 10, the tribulations of cory aquino ;
notes: this week s protest demanding the resignation of mrs corazon aquino may not have unduly disturbed the philippine president. on the eve of the protest, the newly formed cory aquino resign at once movement boasted nearly two million signatures on a petition calling on mrs aquino to step down and hold early elections. but at most only 2,000 people joined the protest. this is, however, the beginning of yet another challenge to mrs aquino s leadership.

sources: ny times, february 26, 1991, section a; page 3; column 1; foreign desk, government opponents and supporters in philippines mark anniversary ;
notes: about 1,000 demonstrators marched near the presidential palace in manila yesterday to demand the resignation of president corazon c. aquino. elsewhere in the city, her supporters celebrated the fifth anniversary of the popular revolt that toppled ferdinand e. marcos and swept mrs. aquino to power.

sources: toronto star, july 23, 1991, p. a17, protest fizzles into rain drenched parade ;
notes: drenching rains, public boredom and some skillful last minute political footwork saved president corazon aquino from a heap of humiliation yesterday. plans by aquino s opponents to rattle her government to its foundations by putting more than a million protesters on to the streets during the last major speech of her presidency fizzled when fewer than 50,000 militant trade unionists marched from manila to quezon city demanding her resignation.

notes: tens of thousands of mourners wept, sang a patriotic song and denounced the government yesterday as they buried the flag draped coffin of a maid hanged for murder in singapore. the tearful seven hour funeral procession and burial mass became an anti government rally as grieving filipinos raised clenched fists and criticized president fidel ramos for failing to prevent the execution.

sources: ny times, september 22, 1995, section a; page 3; column 1; foreign desk, filipinos protest soaring prices for rice ;
notes: public transportation was paralyzed throughout the philippines yesterday by demonstrators protesting higher prices of rice. agriculture officials have blamed a drought for a sharp increase in prices, but critics say the real causes are government mismanagement and supply manipulation. in manila, about 2,000 protesters marched to the malacanang palace to denounce the government. some carried a banner that showed the left half of the face of president fidel ramos and the right half of the former dictator, ferdinand marcos. reuters
